intro: Pochota vulgaris, commonly known as the wild coffee tree, is a species native to Central America and parts of Mexico. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree that typically grows to a height of 10 to 20 meters. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers that develop into fleshy, orange-red berries. The fruit contains a single seed and is often used in traditional medicine. Botanically, it belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like coffee and gardenia.
